pros: None really, not sure what to put here
cons:
Awful management. Either completely non existing or super micromanagement provided with no positive outcome.

I believe those that were managing certain departments, were Providers or people with knowledge of other areas of expertise but were thrown into managerial roles without having managerial experience.

They lacked major people skills. 

Complete disregard towards staff. They basically throw you to the wolves and would ever be around for guidance or input. Provided the absolute most minimum training. 

They lack good management or guidance then will blame you if you don't execute the role well even though they were the ones that did not provide the tools you needed to execute your role well. 

They throw numbers at you or quotas to meet but they don't train or guide you on how to accomplish that goal. 

They have unrealistic expectations of staff members.

Whenever we did have a meeting or was just to discuss what goals we did not meet. 
They never acknowledge when a goal or quotas were met .

review_title: Fine place to start but do not stay long
pros: Allows you to gain speed

review_title: Better get your big girl panties on ...
pros: I worked at Frankford, some of my coworkers are the reason I come back everyday. They hire agency/temp nurses all the time ... those nurse are some of the laziest people to ever work w/ which leaves the actual permanent employee to pick up ALL their slack. They kind of let you get away w/ murder because they are so unorganized. This place has definitely been such a foundation for me ! If you can work at GPHA-Frankford ... you work absolutely ANYWHERE. You will learn great customer service because the majority of the population will give you absolutely no respect.
cons: If you’re the dependable nurse, then you WILL become overwhelmed. Management is TERRIBLE! Everyone is pretty much underpaid & overworked ... so they don’t care about your problems ... There is NO room for your opinion. If you have something to say that they are not in agreement w/ you are immediately threatened to be fired. We ENABLE the pts 100%. It’s so unfortunate that this company gives percs out like it’s candy... the pt’s even know what doctors to ask for to get the percs. Smh I wouldn’t recommend this place to my WORST enemy.

review_title: NOT FOR YOU THEIR AGAINST YOU
pros: Patients, Providers are Great , and good Medical assistant experience if your fresh out of school.
cons: To much work with little pay. They don't want to give you your raise until you finally leave, then you have to hassle them for your money. The leads and supervisor take their authority to far and don't even know what their doing and don't know how to manage a facility. The Supervisor harass you in the work place and belittles you like a child. They accommodate for irate patients that's late and always late because their scared of people and never use the security. High turn over rate for medical assistants and registration assistants. They will try to get rid of you if they don't like you or if they feel intimidated. The leads do things wrong all the time but if you do it its a write up. They don't give you a verbal, or written, they just write you up for anything they feel like. The supervisor makes up her own rules as she go along.

pros: Flexible schedule, the providers genuinely care about their patients
cons:
They push patient encounters which leads to poor patient care and provider burn out. The patients can be very aggressive and will threaten providers. The HR team needs a total overhaul. Some people in the HR team do not know how to interact with employees and leave people with a bad impression. The HR  team can be very passive-aggressive. Basically, HUMAN Resources is horrible with humans. 

The pay is very low compared to other organizations.  The support staff while some are good the majority need to be let go. Because the majority of the support staff are bad, providers complain because their work day does not go smoothly and patients pile up.

pros: I worked for GPHA for 5 years, resigned because my family was moving 5 hours away.  I loved working for Dr. Sui, and Sarah Lai, as they were professional and an amazing support  system
cons: although I was promised my position in the event that my family relocated back, it has been a year long process to rehire. I have met all requirements, and see posting of the exact position posted on multiple job search sites, however, it seems that 5 years experience and meeting all requirements, I am not experienced enough, nor do I meet the required credentials for said postion.

pros: Great coworkers and very approachable management staff. The physicians and managers were always amenable to sharing their knowledge and provided good feedback, and quick to be encouraging.
cons: It's a hectic workplace with a lot of people in a small space. My particular position was somewhat unpredictable and sometimes there would be an overwhelming amount of work and other days, very little work.  However, I did get a good deal of exposure to many aspects of the administrative side of healthcare, which was valuable experience.

pros: Great Salary.  Good benefits.  Pleasant work environment.
cons: Like all behavioral health organizations, the paperwork is insane.  As a Therapist, your entire day is booked with back to back sessions and in order to keep up with the paper work and to secure your job, you will have to donate whatever time is necessary for this without any additional compensation.
